page.title: 06Housing/Energy
page.content: Other building materials: Pulborough stone (hard sandstone with bands of dark chert) and carstone, a hard dark stone found in sandy soil. Bog iron, lignite and ironstone are plentiful. Horsham stone used as roof-tiles from Roman times, was exhausted many years ago.There are few flint-built houses. Gas is laid on only in the southwest corner in Gay Street as a continuation from North Heath; mains electricity is available throughout the area. Farms have stand-by generators, and the old wind pumps are no longer in use. A seismic survey has been carried out along the roads in connection with oil exploration; it seems the Weald is to be a future source of oil. Recently Conoco have submitted applications to drill for oil in several neighbouring parishes; the first has been approved. This area will probably not escape.
